snippet: Firefighters across the state are still battling to contain a dozen large wildfires that have killed at least one person, destroyed hundreds of homes and displaced 13,000 people.
abstract: Dozen big wildfires are burning across California as 11,000 firefighters try to contain them; hundreds of homes have been destroyed and 13,000 people displaced; residents are evacuated in Middletown, Calif, as entire blocks of homes burn down.

byline.contributor: Richard Pérez-Peña contributed reporting from New York.

lead_paragraph: Firefighters across the state are still battling to contain a dozen large wildfires that have killed at least one person, destroyed hundreds of homes and displaced 13,000 people.

headline.main: Amid California Wildfires, Escapes and Choices
headline.print_headline: Amid California Flames, Escapes and Choices
